DOC.brief_title: Chemotherapy Treating Patients With Recurrent Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Evaluate tumor response duration , one-year progression-free survival , one-year overall survival patient recurrent metastatic colorectal carcinoma treat trimetrexate glucuronate , fluorouracil , leucovorin calcium . OUTLINE : Patients receive trimetrexate glucuronate ( TMTX ) IV 1 hour day 1 . Beginning 18 hour TMTX dosage , patient receive leucovorin calcium ( CF ) IV 2 hour . Immediately completion CF infusion , patient receive IV bolus injection fluorouracil ( 5-FU ) . Beginning 4 hour 5-FU infusion , patient receive oral CF every 6 hour 6 dos . Treatment repeat every 14 day absence disease progression unacceptable toxicity long disease remain inoperable . Patients follow every 3 month 1 year , every 6 month 3 year , annually thereafter . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 18-45 patient accrue study within 15 month .
